place.name: BULMER
place.gazetteerText: BULMER, a parish and a subdistrict in the district of Sudbury and county of Essex. The parish lies on the verge of the county, near the river Stour and the Sudbury railway, 2 miles WSW of Sudbury; and has a post office under Sudbury. Acres, 2,779. Real property, £6,251. Pop., 758. Houses, 170. The property is divided among a few. The living is a vicarage, united with the vicarage of Belchamp-Walter, in the diocese of Rochester. Value, £445. Patron, S. M. Raymond, Esq. The church is good. The subdistrict contains nine parishes and an extra-parochial tract. Acres, 17,504. Pop., 4,853. Houses, 1,084. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
